Financial Freedom:Guide to Retiring Early in HK
If you are tired of the 9 to 5 work grind, this article is great for you as you will learn ways to set yourself on the path to financial freedom through investment.
What is financial freedom/financial independence?
Financial Independence, Retire Early (FIRE) is a movement of devotees committed to a lifestyle involving extreme savings (saving up to 80% of monthly salary) and investment that aims to allow them to quit their day jobs or retire from work altogether.

So, when can you retire? Some people suggest that when your savings reach approximately 25 times your yearly expenses, then you may quit your jobs or and retire. This is calculated based on FIRE devotees making small withdrawals from their savings, typically around 4% of the balance yearly, to keep pace with the inflation.
Financial independence retire early calculator
So, when can you retire? You can work this out by an online FIRE calculator. If you are determined enough, you will realize that it is not impossible to retire early!
Step 1
Enter some basic information including your age, annual income, your annual expenses and your current net worth.
Step 2
Enter your asset allocation in percentage. Assets refers to stocks, bonds and cash.
Step 3
Enter the expected returns for each category.
Step 4
Press Calculate to work out the result.
4% rule: What is it?
The 4% rule is a common rule of thumb when it comes to how much you can withdraw from your money in investments in your first year of retirement. As its name suggests, you should be able to comfortably live off 4% of your money in investment during the first year of retirement and then adjust for inflation each subsequent year. If you follow this, you shouldn’t be outliving your money during a 30-year retirement.
